• Conas a láimhseáiltear réadmhaoin
If you are applying for a social assistance payment you must satisfy a means test
Má tá iarratas á chur isteach agat ar íocaíocht cúnaimh shóisialaigh caithfidh tú tástáil mhaoine a chomhlíonadh
All your sources of income (for example, cash income, employment, capital and maintenance) are assessed by the Department of Social Protection (DSP)

Déanann an Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí measúnú ar gach foinse ioncaim de do chuid (mar shampla ioncam airgid thirim, fostaíocht, caipiteal agus cothabháil) Faoi reachtaíocht um Leas Sóisialach áfach, ní chuirtear roinnt míreanna san áireamh agus do chuid acmhainní á measúnú

The purpose of this document is to explain how the DSP assesses your means from capital for social welfare payments (with the exception of Family Income Supplement as capital is not assessed in this income test)
Is é cuspóir an doiciméid seo míniú a thabhairt ar an dóigh a dhéanann an Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí measúnú ar do chuid acmhainní ó chaipiteal i gcomhair íocaíochtaí leasa shóisialaigh
More information on other sources of income and income not taken into account is available in our document on the means test
Tá tuilleadh eolais maidir le foinsí ioncaim eile agus ioncam nach chuirtear san áireamh ar fáil inár ndoiciméad maidir leis an tástáil mhaoine
To find your means from capital, first you must calculate your total capital value
Chun do chuid acmhainní a ríomh ó chaipiteal, sa chéad dul síos ní foláir duit do luach chaipitiúil iomlán a ríomh
You do this by adding together all your sources of capital (for example, property, savings and investments)
Ciallaíonn sé seo go caithfidh tú gach foinse caipitil de do chuid a shuimiú (mar shampla, maoin, coigilteas agus infheistíochtaí)
Then you apply the relevant formula below
Ansin cuir an fhoirmle ábhartha thíos i bhfeidhm
The formula for assessing means from capital for all social welfare payments (except Disability Allowance and Supplementary Welfare Allowance) is as follows:
Is í an fhoirmle chun acmhainní ó chaipiteal a mheasúnú maidir le gach íocaíocht leasa shóisialaigh (seachas Liúntas Míchumais agus Liúntas Leasa Forlíontach) ná mar a leanas:
│Capital │Weekly means assessed │
│Caipiteal │Maoin sheachtainiúil measúnaithe │
│First €20,000 │Nil │
│An chéad €20,000 │Dada │
│An chéad €10,000 eile │€1 in aghaidh gach €1,000 │
│An chéad €10,000 eile │€2 in aghaidh gach €1,000 │
│Balance │€4 per €1,000 │
│Iarmhéid │€4 in aghaidh gach €1,000 │

How property is treated
Conas a láimhseáiltear réadmhaoin
The home in which you live is not included in the assessment of your means from capital unless you are getting an income from it
Ní chuirtear san áireamh an teach ina gcónaíonn tú sa mheasúnú ar do mhaoin ó chaipiteal mura bhfuil ioncam á fháil agat uaidh
If you are getting an income from your home (for example, if you have rented a room in the house) that income is assessed
Má tá ioncam á fháil agat ó do theach (mar shampla, tá seomra ar cíos agat sa teach), déantar measúnú ar an ioncam sin

However, income from renting a room in your home is not assessed if you are getting a State Pension (Non-Contributory) or a Widow's, Widower's or Surviving Civil Partner's (Non-Contributory) Pension and not renting the room means that you would be living alone

Áfach, ní dhéantar measúnú ar ioncam ó sheomra a ligean ar cíos i do theach má tá Pinsean Stáit (Neamh-Ranníocach) nó Pinsean Baintrí, Baintreach Fir nó Páirtnéara Shibhialta Mharthanaigh (Neamh-Ranníocach) á fháil agat agus go mbeifeá i do chónaí leat féin mura mbeadh an seomra ligthe ar cíos agat
If you sell your home, the proceeds of the sale are normally taken into account as means
Má dhíolann tú do theach, is gnách go gcuirtear fáltais an díola san áireamh mar mhaoin

If you are living in accommodation which no longer suits you or which you are no longer able to maintain, you may be able to sell your home and move to more suitable accommodation and have up to €190,500 of the proceeds of the sale exempt from the means test

Má tá cónaí ort i gcóiríocht nach n-oireann duit a thuilleadh nó nach bhfuil tú in ann a choimeád a thuilleadh, d’fhéadfá do theach a dhíol agus bogadh chuig cóiríocht níos oiriúnaí agus a mhéid agus €190,500 d’fháltais an díola bheith díolmhaithe ón tástáil mhaoine
This exemption only applies if you are getting one of the following payments:
Ní bhaineann an díolúine seo ach amháin má tá ceann de na híocaíochtaí a leanas á fáil agat:
• Widow's, Widower's or Surviving civil Partner's (Non-Contributory) Pension (if you are 66 years of age or over)
• Pinsean Baintrí, Baintrí Fir nó Páirtnéara Shibhialta Mharthanaigh (Neamh-Ranníocach) (má tá tú 66 bliain d’aois nó níos sine)
The exemption only applies if you are getting one of the above social welfare payments and sell your house in order to:
Ní bhaineann an díolúine seo ach amháin má tá ceann de na híocaíochtaí thuas á fáil agat agus má dhíolann tú do theach d’fhonn an méid a leanas a dhéanamh:
• Buy or rent more suitable alternative accommodation
• Cóiríocht eile níos oiriúnaí a cheannach nó a fháil ar cíos
• Move into a private nursing home which is registered under the Health (Nursing Homes) Act 1990
• Bogadh isteach chuig teach príobháideach altranais atá cláraithe faoin Acht Sláinte (Tithe Banaltrais), 1990
• Move in with a person who getting a carer's payment to care for you
• Bogadh isteach le duine a bhfuil íocaíocht chúramóra á fáil acu duit
• Move to sheltered or special housing in the voluntary, co-operative, statutory or private sectors
• Bogadh chuig tithíocht dhídeanach nó speisialta sna hearnálacha deonacha, comhoibritheacha, reachtúla nó príobháideacha
Usually the first €190,500 of the sale proceeds is not taken into account
Is gnách nach gcuirtear an chéad €190,500 d’fháltais an díola san áireamh
However, if you use the proceeds of the sale to buy more suitable accommodation, the balance of the proceeds after buying the new accommodation is exempt up to a limit of €190,500
Má úsáideann tú fáltais an díola, áfach, chun cóiríocht níos oiriúnaí a cheannach, tá iarmhéid na bhfáltas i ndiaidh an chóiríocht nua a cheannach díolmhaithe a fhad le teorainn €190,500
Investment income from the sale of your home
Ioncam infheistíochta ó dhíol do thí
Any benefit you get from investing the sale proceeds is assessable as means
Tá aon rud a rachadh chun do shochair ó fháltais an díola a infheistiú inmheasúnaithe mar mhaoin
Any interest paid and retained is assessable as capital
Tá aon ús a íocadh agus a coimeádadh inmheasúnaithe mar chaipiteal

However, the Department of Social Protection's Operational Guidelines on Means Assessment state that an allowance should be made where a person has significant maintenance expenses, such as nursing home costs, which are met out of interest payments

Luaitear i dTreoirlínte Oibriúcháin maidir le Tástáil Mhaoine gur cheart go ndéanfaí lamháltas má tá costais shuntasacha chothabhála le híoc ag duine, ar nós costais teach altranais, as a n-íoctar ag íocaíochtaí úis
In such cases, the interest on the exempted capital (up to a maximum of €190,500) may be disregarded as means
Sa chás sin, féadfar neamhaird a thabhairt ar an ús ar an gcaipiteal díolmhaithe (a fhad le €190,500) mar mhaoin
Leaving your home but not selling
Ag fágáil do thí agus gan é a dhíol
If, due to old age or incapacity, you leave your home either on a temporary basis or indefinitely, the value of your home will not be assessed as means
Má fhágann tú do theach, de bharr seanaoise nó éagumais, ar bhonn sealadach nó ar feadh tréimhse neamhchinnte, ní dhéanfar luach do thí a mheasúnú mar mhaoin
However, if it is put to profitable use (for example, rented out), the capital value of the house will then be assessed as means
Má bhaintear feidhm bhrabúsach as do theach (mar shampla, má ligtear ar cíos é), measúnófar luach caipitil an tí mar mhaoin
The home in which you live is not included in the assessment of your means from capital (see above)
Ní chuirtear san áireamh an teach ina gcónaíonn tú sa mheasúnú ar do mhaoin ó chaipiteal (féach thuas)
If you own a house which is let, you are assessed on the capital value of the property
Má tá teach agat a ligtear ar cíos, déanfar measúnú ort ar luach caipitil na réadmhaoine
You will not be assessed on the income from the letting
Ní dhéanfar measúnú ort ar an ioncam ón leasú
Any outstanding mortgage registered against the property is deducted from the market value to find the capital value
Asbhaintear aon mhorgáiste atá gan íoc ón luach margaidh leis an luach caipitil a ríomh

However, if the mortgage on the home in which you live has been re-structured to raise capital to buy the second property, this re-structured mortgage will not be deducted from the capital assessment of the second property

Má tá athstruchtúrú déanta ar an morgáiste ar an teach ina gcónaíonn tú chun caipiteal a chruthú chun an dara maoin a cheannach, ní asbhainfear an morgáiste athstruchtúrtha seo ón measúnú caipitil don dara réadmhaoin
For all second homes the property must be capable of being sold, let or put to profitable use before a capital value assessment is applied
Cásanna ina ndéantar ioncam ó chíos a mheasúnú
More information about the assessment of capital as means can be found on the Department of Social Protection website
Má tá leas saoil agat i réadmhaoin, déantar measúnú ar an ioncam ó chíos seachas ar an luach caipitil
Situations where rental income is assessed
Déanfar measúnú ar an luach caipitil ar an ngnáthbhealach, áfach, mura bhfuil an réadmhaoin ligthe ar cíos – féach ‘Luach Caipitil' thuas
Usually income from renting a property is not assessed. However there are some situations where rental income is assessed
Déantar ioncam ó chíos a mheasúnú mar airgead tirim sa tástáil mhaoine
• If you have a life interest in a property the rental income is assessed instead of the capital value
I gcás gach athbhaile, ní mór gur féidir an réadmhaoin a dhíol, a ligean ar cíos nó a chur chun úsáide brabúsaí sula gcuirfear measúnú ar luach caipitil i bhfeidhm
• If you apply for Family Income Supplement (FIS) rental income from the letting of property or land will be taken into account when assessing your income (the capital value is not assessed)
Is féidir teacht ar níos mó faisnéise faoi mheasúnú ar chaipiteal mar mhaoin ar láithreán gréasáin na Roinne Coimirce Sóisialaí
Assessment of capital for couples
Measúnú ar chaipiteal le haghaidh lánúineacha
If you have a joint account with your spouse, civil partner or cohabitant, legally the total amount in the account is owned by each of you
Má tá comhchuntas agat le do chéile, páirtnéir sibhialta nó comháitritheoir, is faoi úinéireacht na beirte agaibh an méid iomlán atá sa chuntas, de réir an dlí
Therefore it could be assessed in full against each of you
Ar an ábhar sin, is féidir measúnú a dhéanamh ar an méid iomlán i leith na beirte agaibh
However, if you and your spouse, civil partner or cohabitant are both getting means-tested social assistance payments, it will be assessed either on a shared basis or against only one of you

Ar a shon sin, má tá íocaíochtaí cúnaimh shóisialta ar a ndéantar tástáil mhaoine á bhfáil agat agus ag do pháirtnéir sibhialta nó do chomháitritheoir, déanfar measúnú air ar bhonn roinnte nó i leith duine amháin agaibh
You can read more about assessing the means of a couple for social assistance payments
Is féidir leat níos mó a léamh faoi mheasúnú a dhéanamh ar mhaoin lánúine le haghaidh íocaíochtaí cúnaimh shóisialta
